benchmark_details.name: DEPEND EVAL (Dependency Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: DEPEND EVAL is a hierarchical benchmark designed to evaluate LLMs' ability to reason about structured code repositories through three progressively challenging tasks: Dependency Recognition, Repository Construction, and Multi-file Editing, across eight programming languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs' understanding capabilities at the code repository level, addressing repository-level reasoning for software development.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Not enough languages; currently focuses on only three core tasks.

data.source: Real-world repositories collected from GitHub API.
data.annotation: Filtered and manually curated for quality and relevance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on predicted and ground truth outputs comparison.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in correctly identifying dependencies and constructing repositories.
methodology.validation: Evaluated across various models and programming languages.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data anonymized and stored securely with restricted access.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants can withdraw from the study at any time.
